snippet: The prospects for an agreement to protect old forests and regulate logging in California dimmed somewhat today as the state's timber industry rejected a proposal put forward last week by several environmental groups and a large lumber company.    ...
lead_paragraph: The prospects for an agreement to protect old forests and regulate logging in California dimmed somewhat today as the state's timber industry rejected a proposal put forward last week by several environmental groups and a large lumber company. The Timber Association of California, the trade group representing the state's lumber companies and timberland owners, instead issued its own proposal.

headline.main: California Timber Industry Rejects Logging Plan

byline.original: By ANDREW POLLACK, Special to The New York Times
